content.description:
AVERAGE ANNUAL GRAIN PRICES IN ENGLAND AT FIVE-YEAR INTERVALS, 1650–1705

Source: Adapted from William Fleetwood, Chronicon preciosum: or, An account of English money, the price of corn, and other commodities, for the last 600 years, 1707, pp. 125-128.

Notes: A “quarter” was a traditional English grain measure equal to eight bushels.A shilling was an English monetary unit equal to one-twentieth of a pound sterling.Malt barley was primarily used for making beer.
content.question: Which of the following is an accurate description of the trend in malt barley prices shown on the graph?

choices.label: Malt barley prices increased slightly in the period 1650 to 1705.
Malt barley prices showed a steady decline in the period 1650 to 1705.
Malt barley prices showed considerable variation but no long-term change in the period 1650 to 1705.
Malt barley prices showed considerable variation but overall slightly declined in the period 1650 to 1705.

content.answer: Malt barley prices showed considerable variation but overall slightly declined in the period 1650 to 1705.

topic.text: 3.3: Continuities and Changes to Economic Practice and Development

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
